name: Chocolate Lava Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Grease and flour ramekins.
Melt chocolate and butter together.
Whisk eggs, yolks, and sugar until pale and thick.
Fold in the melted chocolate mixture.
Gently fold in the flour and salt.
Pour batter into ramekins and bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are set but center is still gooey.
Let cool slightly before inverting onto plates. Serve immediately.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
steps: Slice the cooked chicken breasts.
In a large bowl, toss the chopped romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing.
Add the sliced chicken, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
Gently toss everything together. Serve immediately.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy.
Remove bacon from skillet with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
In a medium bowl, whisk eggs, Parmesan cheese, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Add cooked spaghetti to the bowl and toss well.
Add the egg mixture and cooked bacon to the skillet and toss everything together until the eggs are cooked and the pasta is coated with the sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately.

name: Nasi Goreng Kampung
ingredients: 2 cups cooked white rice (day-old is best)
2 dried anchovies (ikan bilis), fried until crispy
Vegetables (e.g., long beans, cabbage, carrots), sliced
Garnish: fried egg, cucumber slices, keropok (crackers)
steps: Heat oil in a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and sliced onion and stir-fry until fragrant.
Push the garlic and onion to one side of the pan. Pour in the beaten egg and scramble until cooked. Break it into pieces.
Add the cooked rice, sweet soy sauce, and chili paste (if using). Stir-fry well to combine.
Add the sliced vegetables and fried anchovies. Continue to stir-fry until the vegetables are slightly tender.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with a fried egg, cucumber slices, and keropok.

name: Kung Pao Chicken
ingredients: 1 tablespoon rice wine or dry sherry
1/2 cup dried red chili peppers, cut into 1-inch pieces
Sauce: 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, 2 tablespoons water
steps: In a bowl, marinate the chicken with soy sauce, rice wine, and cornstarch for at least 15 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk together all the sauce ingredients.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the marinated chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through.
Add the dried chili peppers, ginger, and garlic. Stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in the prepared sauce and cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
Stir in the roasted peanuts. Serve hot with rice.

name: Classic Beef Burger
steps: Season the ground beef with salt and pepper. Form into a patty.
Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the burger patty for about 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer to your preference.
In the last minute of cooking, place the cheddar cheese on top of the patty to melt.
Lightly toast the burger bun halves.
Assemble the burger: place lettuce, tomato, onion, and pickle slices on the bottom bun. Top with the cheese-covered patty.
Spread your desired sauces on the top bun and place it over the patty. Serve immediately.
